Posted By: PinkleDadandy (5/14/2012 10:04:28 AM)

posts.post_content:
[Sigarda, Host of Herons](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sigarda, Host of Herons), [Avacyn, Angel of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Angel of Hope), [Empyrial Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Archangel) (or alternatively [Platinum Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Platinum Angel)), [Iona, Shield of Emeria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iona, Shield of Emeria), [Linvala, Keeper of Silence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Linvala, Keeper of Silence), [Angel of Jubilation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Jubilation), [Gaddock Teeg](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gaddock Teeg), 2\*[Privileged Position](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Privileged Position), [Rule of Law](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rule of Law),  [Gavony Township](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Gavony Township), [Cavern of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cavern of Souls), [Alchemist's Refuge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alchemist's Refuge) (or alternatively [Vedalken Orrery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vedalken Orrery)), [Ghostway](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghostway), [Archangel's Light](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archangel's Light) (or alternatively [Elixir of Immortality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elixir of Immortality)).  
  
Disregarding the feasibility of realizing the entire combo and the overall efficiency when piloting, creating a deck with all these cards combined results in a deck **that can't lose**.
posts.html:
Sigarda, Host of Herons, Avacyn, Angel of Hope, Empyrial Archangel (or alternatively Platinum Angel), Iona, Shield of Emeria, Linvala, Keeper of Silence, Angel of Jubilation, Gaddock Teeg, 2*Privileged Position, Rule of Law, Gavony Township, Cavern of Souls, Alchemist's Refuge (or alternatively Vedalken Orrery), Ghostway, Archangel's Light (or alternatively Elixir of Immortality).

Disregarding the feasibility of realizing the entire combo and the overall efficiency when piloting, creating a deck with all these cards combined results in a deck that can't lose.

Posted By: StoicChampion (4/29/2012 12:50:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.

posts.post_content:
If anyone ever gets out Blossom, Bubbles, Buttercup, and Sorin-in-Drag out at the same time....o.O  
  
Yeah, that is probably a game you are going to win.  
  
Oh and Maelstrom Archangel and Kaalia of the Vast in the same deck make your idea completely feasible StoicChampion. Your general should probably be Scion of the Ur-Dragon, running all 5 Invasion Dragons, all 5 Kamigawa Dragons, and all 5 Planar Chaos Dragons, plus the Powerpuff Girls Angels.  
  
In fact, Maelstrom Archangel should be the only non-Legendary creature in your deck. :)  
  
EDIT: don't care if banned or not. must have Kokusho for the sake of Mega Cycle completeness! when you take him out they are just going to notice you are also running the Power Puffs with Kaalia and then they will still stop playing with you- might as well pull as much B.S. in Game 1 as possible before getting banned for life from your playgroup ;D

Posted By: ScurbyPirate (4/26/2012 6:08:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It can get countered. 0.5 / 5.  
  
~  
  
On a serious note...WOW! She's like the polar opposite twin to [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel). While Baneslayer kicked ass in combat and gained you a lot of life, Sigarda is less effective in combat, but is 99% protected from removal. She's pretty much a [Thrun, the Last Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thrun, the Last Troll) on wings. The fact she is legendary kind of balances her...I guess...  
  
Her popularity all depends on how much people can up with for a WG deck, which doesn't seem to be that popular right now. If a some good decks arise, you can bet your Lotuses that she's going to be the frontliner f all of them!

Posted By: Mickacabra (4/28/2012 8:14:20 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I hate this card so much! And I mean hate in "fear and respect" sense. I don't think it's unfair, but I'm just griping that forced sac was my last trump card as a MBC lover trying to get around white removal resistant creatures! This thing is harder boot than [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus), [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul), and [Blightsteel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel)! She completely shuts down [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator) too!  
  
Pwns two of my red faves as well -- [wildfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wildfire) and [destructive force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=destructive force) (the latter kills her, but you're behind five lands that your opp didn't have to sac).  
  
Answers: [Black Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Sun's Zenith) and hope they don't have a ton of [Young Wolf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Young Wolf) or [Strangleroot Geist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Strangleroot Geist) running around to ruin your day. Or [Life's Finale](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life's Finale) and pray you can survive till turn 6 to pull it off...  
  
bro-tip: think of this card as an investment. It WILL be played in every for... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I hate this card so much! And I mean hate in "fear and respect" sense. I don't think it's unfair, but I'm just griping that forced sac was my last trump card as a MBC lover trying to get around white removal resistant creatures! This thing is harder boot than Progenitus, Emrakul, and Blightsteel! She completely shuts down Phyrexian Obliterator too!

Pwns two of my red faves as well -- wildfire and destructive force (the latter kills her, but you're behind five lands that your opp didn't have to sac).

Answers: Black Sun's Zenith and hope they don't have a ton of Young Wolf or Strangleroot Geist running around to ruin your day. Or Life's Finale and pray you can survive till turn 6 to pull it off...

Posted By: DragonLord132 (4/27/2012 12:06:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: As she is, she is ridiculously good. She can't be [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)ed or [Diabolic Edict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Edict)ed, and she's a 5/5 for 5 as well. At least she can still be [Wrath of God](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wrath of God)ed and blocked. Not that White and Green aren't good at making her indestructible (e.g., [Shield of the Oversoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shield of the Oversoul)) and unblockable (e.g., [Spirit Mantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Mantle)) though. She will be scary when she hits kitchen tables - and maybe Standard ones as well.
posts.html:
